past simple and past participle of
name
name verb [T]
(GIVE/SAY NAME)
B1 to give someone or something a name: [ + two objects ] We named our dogs Shandy and Belle. A man named Dennis answered the door.
B1 to say what something or someone's name is: In the first question you had to name three types of monkey. He couldn't name his attacker.
More examplesFewer examplesWe've just got a new cat, but we haven't named him yet.Paul was named after his grandad.The Queen attended a ceremony to name the ship.Some parents chose to name their children after characters from the show.They named their son Isaac after the biblical character.

name verb [T]
(CHOOSE)
B2 to choose someone or something: Just name the time and I'll be there. Name your conditions/terms/price. Ms Martinez has been named (as) the new Democratic candidate.
